Publication-ready table for the rank table

Source: R/bpc_publication.R
get_rank_of_players_table.Rd

Publication-ready table for the rank table

get_rank_of_players_table(
  bpc_object,
  format = "latex",
  digits = 3,
  caption = "Estimated posterior ranks",
  n = 1000
)

Arguments

bpc_object

a bpc object
format

A character string. same formats utilized in the knitr::kable function

  • 'latex': output in latex format

  • 'simple': appropriated for the console

  • 'pipe': Pandoc's pipe tables

  • 'html': for html formats

  • 'rst'

  • 'simple' appropriated for the console
digits

number of digits in the table
caption

a string containing the caption of the table
n

number of times we are sampling the posterior

Value

a formatted table

Examples

# \donttest{
m<-bpc(data = tennis_agresti,
player0 = 'player0',
player1 = 'player1',
result_column = 'y',
model_type = 'bt',
solve_ties = 'none')

#> Running MCMC with 4 parallel chains...
#> 
#> Chain 1 finished in 1.8 seconds.
#> Chain 2 finished in 1.7 seconds.
#> Chain 3 finished in 1.9 seconds.
#> Chain 4 finished in 1.8 seconds.
#> 
#> All 4 chains finished successfully.
#> Mean chain execution time: 1.8 seconds.
#> Total execution time: 2.0 seconds.
t<-get_rank_of_players_table(m)
print(t)

#> \begin{table}
#> 
#> \caption{Estimated posterior ranks}
#> \centering
#> \begin{tabular}[t]{lrrr}
#> \toprule
#> Parameter & MedianRank & MeanRank & StdRank\\
#> \midrule
#> Graf & 1 & 1.349 & 0.588\\
#> Seles & 2 & 2.127 & 0.894\\
#> Navratilova & 3 & 3.045 & 0.862\\
#> Sabatini & 4 & 3.681 & 0.826\\
#> Sanchez & 5 & 4.798 & 0.495\\
#> \bottomrule
#> \end{tabular}
#> \end{table}
# }
